de.eckhartarnold.client

Class ControlPanelOverlay

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.eckhartarnold.client.PanelOverlayBase
      • de.eckhartarnold.client.ControlPanelOverlay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttachmentListener, ResizeListener

    public class ControlPanelOverlay
extends PanelOverlayBase
    Puts a ControlPanel in a popup window.

    The popup windows opens up whenever the user moves the mouse over a given widget (which usually is the ImagePanel) and stays open for a few seconds. The popup panel can be dragged by the user by grabbing its border.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ControlPanelOverlay

        public ControlPanelOverlay(ControlPanel controlPanel,
                           Widget baseWidget,
                           java.lang.String initialPosition)
        Creates a new overlay control panel which takes a given control panel an catches it in a popup window. The popup is opened when ever widget fires a mouse event.
        Parameters:
        controlPanel - the control panel to be overlaid
        baseWidget - the widget over which the control panel is laid
        initialPosition - integer value from 1 to 4 that indicates the corner where the popup panel is to appear initially: 1 = upper left, 2 = upper right, 3 = lower right, 4 = lower left

      • prepareResized

        public void prepareResized()
        Description copied from interface: ResizeListener
        Called after a parent widget has been resized, but before the new size is processed via onResized. The method prepareResized is needed to allow composite widgets that contain absolute panels to temporarily detach these absolute panels in order to allow the browser to calculate widget sizes correctly. The implementation of onResized can then re-attach the detached absolute panels. Methods prepareResized and onResized should therefore always be used in conjunction.
